meanings.definition: The act of inhabiting or dwelling in a place.
meanings.sent1: The inhabitants of the forest built cozy inhabitations among the trees.
meanings.sent2: The city had various inhabitations ranging from apartments to houses.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels found the birdhouse to be a suitable inhabitation for their acorn stash.
meanings.sent4: The old castle stood as a majestic inhabitation overlooking the valley.
meanings.sent5: The igloo served as a unique inhabitation in the snowy landscape.
